Posts.Content: Sep 15, 2008 05:30AM Wintermoon623 wrote: I had the bolus every other day.  I had no bad effects from it. It wasn't until after the 8 boosts in the end that my skin had reaction.
Posts.Title: Anyone use BOLUS embmom EmilyJane

Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2007 09:59AM Wintermoon623 wrote: For two solid weeks before I found my lump I kept waking up repeatedly during the night with a vague feeling of unrest...like something wasn't right.  I also started thinking a lot about death for some reason.  Then the week before I found the lump I became preoccupied with worry that something in my breasts wasn't right. I was focused on the left breast because it has always had more tissue than the right and I always thought that if I ever had a breast problem it would be in the left.  My cancer is in the right breast.  Still, I think there is something to intuition. I'd like to think my deceased father's spirit was prompting me with all those evening wake ups.  That's just the way I like to think of it. Since finding the mass I have slept very well.
Posts.Title: Premonition???? JoyRebecca CapeTownJanine

Posts.Content: Sep 15, 2008 05:27AM Wintermoon623 wrote: My nipple is now beige most of the time and I think that's permanent.  It's weird looking compared to the other one.  Ask your doc.  I've found that they don't tell you everything that can happen to you....probably don't want to scare people or put thoughts in your head but I've learned to ask about everything, I don't care how annoying I get.
Posts.Title: Awkward or Stupid Nipple question... sta1129 amberyba

Posts.Content: Jul 29, 2008 10:09AM Wintermoon623 wrote: I'm so glad to hear that the rest of my boobage will get a break.  They told me today I have 12 more treatments and then 8 boosts.  I should be done with all of this Aug. 26th.  I can't wait.
Posts.Title: boosts?? zschweeb zschweeb

Posts.Content: Jun 9, 2008 07:29AM Wintermoon623 wrote: Sable, I know how you feel.  My hair was short to begin with, but it was still hard to watch it disappear.  I did not shave my head, but had it chopped very close to my scalp.  I still had tingling and tenderness, but it wasn't too bad.  I was ready and waiting with wigs and scarves.  I think it is better to be prepared, but losing your hair is not an easy thing...I don't care how ready you think you are.  I am now two weeks past my final chemo treatment and I have peach fuzz all over my head!!  There is more every day and although I'm not crazy about the color (pure white!!) I am so happy to see hair growth.  When I started my chemo in February I could not imagine being done in May...it seemed forever away...but here it is the second week of June and I am done!!  I still have rads to go, but the chemo is done and by the end of summer I will have my hair back!!   Hang in there...you will too.
Posts.Title: Mourning for my hair Sable MsKarin

Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2008 07:54PM Wintermoon623 wrote: I had just the opposite after A/C....horrible constipation.  Whichever you get, the advice to drink as much water as you can possibly stand is right on the money.  I had trouble drinking as well as eating...I kept switching between flavored water and carbonated water...whatever I could get down.  Eating small meals throughout the day is also very good advice. A/C is tough...take care of yourself and don't push to do more than you are up to.
Posts.Title: Help from more senior chemo girl (ac) flyrzfan Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Jun 25, 2008 07:32AM Wintermoon623 wrote: I am just four weeks out from last chemo treatment and I have salt and pepper fuzz on my head...more salt than pepper....and I was not nearly this gray before!!  I have a question about eyebrows and eyelashes....as much as I'd like my hair back, it's the loss of the brows and especially lashes that has me a bit unsettled.  I didn't lose them until AFTER the last Taxol...is that usual?  How long before I see something coming back?  I know this is trivial in the grand scheme of things with this disease but as I am starting radiation soon (and I'm scared) I'd like to be hopeful that I'll see brows and lashes soon.  Is that possible?
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2008 09:54AM Wintermoon623 wrote: They tried to put in port yesterday but could not find the vein.  They tried on both sides and I sure am sore and black and blue today.  Was supposed to start chemo today but it had to be pushed back a week.  So now I guess I'm a February girl. Will be going to radiologist on Monday who will put in port.  They assured me they have equipment which will ensure they find the vein. Has this happened to anyone else?
Posts.Title: I.V Port kissta Cathy-CA

Posts.Content: Oct 20, 2007 11:24AM Wintermoon623 wrote: Had biopsies today.  Fortunately the nodule in my left breast was a cyst that they aspirated.  They also found a very small nodule near the original lump that I found and aspirated that as well.  The original lump is cancer.  I should have results of biopsies by next Wednesay. We'll go from there.  This has all finally sunk in.  I have had wonderful support from family, co-workers and boards like this one.  I am ready to do whatever is necessary to keep on keeping on.
Posts.Title: Another worried newbie Wintermoon623 Wintermoon623

Posts.Content: Oct 17, 2007 12:22AM Wintermoon623 wrote: Update:  I saw very good breast surgeon yesterday.  She took a lot of time with me and was very thorough.  It appears that I have Stage II breast cancer in right breast.  Left breast, she is unsure.  It could be a cyst.  She is sending me for biospy and MRI.  After that, we will decide which surgery I will need.  I will have to follow up with radiation and/or chemo.  I asked her if there was any possibility that lump in right breast could turn out to be benign.  She said no.  She is 99% sure.  The biopsy will give her the other 1% and tell us if there is anything further.  I am in a state of shock.  I am terriby frightened, but I know I'm going to have to stay strong and face this battle. I thank you all for your kind words.  I guess I'll be moving to the Just Diagnosed message board soon.
Posts.Title: Another worried newbie Wintermoon623 Wintermoon623

Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2008 02:53PM Wintermoon623 wrote: I'm at treatment 15 and just now turning pink.  I started using Jeans Cream before I started treatment and I think it's why I am not red yet. (I am very fair)  Rad techs said not to use anything until I turn red, but I thought that was stupid.  Why be in pain and miserable when you can avoid it? Is the redness supposed to indicate that it is working?  I did feel tingling from the first treatment and the boob is sensitive to touch and rough material.  I can't wait for rads to be over.  In some ways it is easier than chemo but in some ways it's worse.  I am extremely tired and I won't be done until almost the end of August.  I hope I can still crawl into work by then.  Although I don't have to drive far for treatment, it is tiring to do it every day...
Posts.Title: How Early can SE's begin? easyquilts AccidentalTourist

Posts.Content: Aug 14, 2008 12:50PM Wintermoon623 wrote:
Posts.Title: RADIATION INCREASES SURVIVABILITY OF HIGH RISK PATIENTS. worriedhubby MarieKelly

Posts.Content: Oct 24, 2007 07:51AM Wintermoon623 wrote: Harley 44: I'm 48 and still have regular periods.  Is this Tamoxifen given after another kind of chemo?  Or is this the chemo?  Do they always do chemo first and then radiation?  Or is radiation first?  Verjim: I know how you feel too.  I'm going to start writing all my questions down.  My surgeon suggested we have a pre-surgery consultation so I can ask questions.  The one good thing about this is that I really like my surgeon so far.  She is very willing to take time with you (she spent almost an hour on the phone with me last night).
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed and have questions Wintermoon623 Harley44

Posts.Content: Oct 24, 2007 09:48AM Wintermoon623 wrote: Thanks so much Harley44.  While part of me feels like I'm headed to the fires of Modor...the other part feels hopeful that I will beat this.  Not what I was expecting to deal with at this point in my life.  I was gearing up for menopause...but nooooo...the universe decided that it had something far more "interesting" for me to handle.  Thank you all for your information, kindness and support.
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed and have questions Wintermoon623 Harley44

Posts.Content: Oct 24, 2007 08:00AM Wintermoon623 wrote:
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed and have questions Wintermoon623 Harley44

Posts.Content: Feb 21, 2008 11:46AM Wintermoon623 wrote: Good luck with your port insert.  I was one of the 1% that had the lung nicked (followed by a lung collapse) but that is very rare...(I really should play the lottery).  I had first chemo a week later and I really can't say that the port bothers me at all.  It does make drawing blood and infusing the chemo much easier.  You'll be fine.
Posts.Title: Having a port put in siuane msthanglila

Posts.Content: Mar 6, 2008 09:33AM Wintermoon623 wrote: Good morning everyone.  I had my second A/C last week and now have funny rash on side of neck.  Saw onc yesterday for blood work and she said I'm having allergic reaction to antinausea med.  She gave me script for a topical that I hope will clear this up.  Otherwise I am getting balder by the second...now almost balder than my dad was.  I am so tired.  Getting through the work day but crashing on the couch when I get home.  I have 6 more treatments to go.  Everything tastes awful.  I know we're supposed to drink a lot of water (and I used to be a big water drinker) but it is hard to get it down now...even the flavored ones.   Any suggestions?  Hope everyone has a good day.
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: May 12, 2008 12:47PM Wintermoon623 wrote: I have last Taxol on May 21st.  Then it's on to rads at some point this summer.  The muscle and bone pain (from Taxol and Nulasta) has been the worst part of the Taxol treatment for me.  But it is better than the nausea and mouth sludge I had with A/C.  I will be glad when all of this is over for all of us. My eyelashes and eyebrows are vanishing.  No sign of head hair regrowth but I've had to shave my legs this past weekend.  Is that a hopeful sign?  lol
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2008 08:08AM Wintermoon623 wrote: I will finally start chemo tomorrow.  Or at least I hope so.  I was supposed to start last week, but after a failed port insertion attempt...my left lung collapsed.  I was walking around for three days, working, cleaning, doing laundery and wondering why I was so short of breath.  I have no history of asthma or allergies...so finally I called surgeon who promptly sent me to the hospital.  The only good thing that came out of it is that it greatly diminshed my fear of chemo.  After a chest tube (most unpleasant)...I think I can handle the chemo. Anyway, I am due to start tomorrow.  I am scheduled for 8 treatments followed by radiation.  I just keeping telling myself that it is only 4 months and I can get through it.  Good luck to all of you February gals.
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2008 10:03AM Wintermoon623 wrote: Hi.  I am officially joining the February 2008 club.  Was supposed to start chemo today, but surgeon could not get the port in yesterday...although she tried and I am very black and blue as proof she couldn't get the vein (apparently hiding behind artery).  Will have to have radiologist put in port on Monday so I will start chemo on February 6th.  I'm a single mom of three and work full time so I'm hoping I get through the chemo ok.
